titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Alfred Ezra Mirsky papers, Rockefeller University Faculty FA131

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-05-09 00:06:25 -0400.

change.item: Paper finding aid converted to EAD/XML by AureXus in 2010. Imported into the Archvists’ Toolkit by Becky Robbins.

did.unittitle: Alfred Ezra Mirsky papers, Rockefeller University Faculty
did.physdesc: 70 boxes; 7 volumes; 4 packages; 6 slide boxes, 36 linear feet

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Alfred Ezra Mirsky, 1900-1974, biochemist and physiologist at The Rockefeller University (earlier RIMR) from 1927 until his death in 1974. Engaged in research on proteins and properties of the cell nucleus. He was one of the first scientists to isolate and characterize the Messenger RNA as the genetic material of the mammalian cells. Founded the Christmas Lectures for high school students held on campus since 1959. As Chairman of the Faculty Committee on Educational Policies, he helped shape policies in restructuring the old Rockeªfeller Institute to a graduate university. He was active in furthering the publication of scientific literature through book publishing and as consultªant to Scientific American. Coeditor with Jean Brachet of The Cell, Volumes I thru VI. Editor of the Journal of General Physiology, 1951-1961.

eventgrp.event: Born October 17, Flushing, New York
Graduated Ethical Culture School, New York
A.B. Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass.
Attended College of Physicians and Surgeons, Columbia University, New York
National Research Council Medical Fellowship
University of Cambridge, Cambridge, England (under Barcroft, J.)
Harvard Medical School, Cambridge, Mass. (under Henderson, L.J.)
Ph.D. University of Cambridge, Cambridge, England
Assistant, Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research, New York
Associate, RIMR
Visiting Professor, California Institute of Technology, Pasadena, California; worked with Linus Pauling and visited China
Associate Member, RIMR
Member, RIMR (1954 title changed to Professor)
Honorary M. D., University of Gothenburg, Sweden
Honorary Professor, University of Santiago, Chile
Laureate in Biological Sciences, University of Palermo, Italy
Librarian, Rockefeller University
Professor Emeritus, Rockefeller University
Died June 19, New York City, Rockefeller University Committee
Committee on Laboratory Helpers and Technicians, RIMR
Chairman, Faculty Committee on Educational Policies, RI
Founded Christmas Lectures for High School Students
Chairman, Committee on Physiology, RI
Faculty Committee, Faculty appointments and promotions, RU
Committee on Biological Sciences, RU
Editor, Journal of General Physiology
on Editorial Board, Journal of General Physiology
Editor with Jean Brachet of The Cell Volumes I thru VI
Advisory Board of Evolutionary Biology
Honorary Editor, Journal of General Physiology
Science Advisor, Institute on Man and Science, Rennselaerville, N.Y.

bioghist.p: Member of: American Anthropological Association, American Philosophical Society, National Academy of Sciences, American Chemical Society, Society of Biological Chemists, Society of General Physiologists, Genetics Society of America, American Naturalists Society, Deutsche Akademie der Naturforscher, American Academy of Arts and Sciences, Phi Beta Kappa, Society for Cell Biology, Society for the Study of Development and Growth, Harvey Society, Sigma Xi

eventgrp.event: Married Reba Paeff (d. Nov. 22, 1966)
Born daughter, Reba (Mrs. Robert Goodman)
Born son, Jonathan Mirsky
Married Sonia Wohl

bioghist.p: Grandchildren: Reba (Robin) Goodman; Melinda Goodman; Peter Goodman; Nancy Goodman

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arranged by subject and in chronological order.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted pending permission from Rockefeller University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Types of records include: biographical material, correspondence, subject files, manuscripts, lab notes, photographs, slides, laboratory memorabilia, and published papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1965 and 1973 biography prepared for RU Press Bibliography. Record of disposition of books and periodicals from laboratory.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection of correspondence was deposited from the Office of Faculty and Student Records. It consists primarily of administrative correspondence between Dr. Mirsky, Simon Flexner, Herbert Gasser, Detlev Bronk and Frederick Seitz. A few items were in correspondence with the business manager.

Included are a few early pre-employment letters; complete employment history; arrangements made for period of time spent in California at the laboratory of Lineus Pauling and included a typed, signed letter from Dr. Pauling dated December 2, 1935 expressing admiration for Dr. Mirsky. Included are a few handwritten letters from Mrs. Reba Mirsky and some newspaper clippings about Mrs. Mirsky's musical interest and involvement.
